post.summary: CancelAction stops an Action.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

post.summary: GetAction gets an result of given Action.

output.description: Current Action output; may be partial if Action is still running.

pmm_agent_id.description: pmm-agent ID where this Action is running / was run.

used with implementation specific semantics.

post.summary:
AddExternal adds external service and adds external exporter.
It automatically adds a service to inventory, which is running on provided "node_id",
then adds an "external exporter" agent to inventory, which is running on provided "runs_on_node_id".

metrics_path.description: Path under which metrics are exposed, used to generate URI.

node_id.description: Node identifier on which a external service is been running. Required.

password.description: HTTP basic auth password for collecting metrics.

runs_on_node_id.description: Node identifier on which a external exporter is been running. Required.

scheme.description: Scheme to generate URI to exporter metrics endpoints.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Required.

username.description: HTTP basic auth username for collecting metrics.

external_exporter.description: ExternalExporter runs on any Node type, including Remote Node.

disabled.description: If disabled, metrics from this exporter will not be collected.

metrics_path.description: Path under which metrics are exposed, used to generate URI.

runs_on_node_id.description: Node identifier where this instance runs.

scheme.description: Scheme to generate URI to exporter metrics endpoints.

username.description: HTTP basic auth username for collecting metrics.

service.description: ExternalService represents a generic External service instance.

node_id.description: Node identifier where this service instance runs.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

post.summary:
AddMongoDB adds MongoDB Service and starts several Agents.
It automatically adds a service to inventory, which is running on provided "node_id",
then adds "mongodb_exporter", and "qan_mongodb_profiler" agents
with provided "pmm_agent_id" and other parameters.

add_node.description: AddNodeParams is a params to add new node to inventory while adding new service.

container_id.description: Container identifier. If specified, must be a unique Docker container identifier.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name.

address.description: Node and Service access address (DNS name or IP). Required.

node_id.description:
Node identifier on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

node_name.description:
Node name on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

password.description: MongoDB password for exporter and QAN agent access.

pmm_agent_id.description: The "pmm-agent" identifier which should run agents. Required.

qan_mongodb_profiler.description: If true, adds qan-mongodb-profiler-agent for provided service.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Required.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

username.description: MongoDB username for exporter and QAN agent access.

mongodb_exporter.description: MongoDBExporter runs on Generic or Container Node and exposes MongoDB Service metrics.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

status.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

qan_mongodb_profiler.description: QANMongoDBProfilerAgent runs within pmm-agent and sends MongoDB Query Analytics data to the PMM Server.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

status.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

username.description: MongoDB username for getting profiler data.

service.description: MongoDBService represents a generic MongoDB instance.

node_id.description: Node identifier where this instance runs.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

post.summary:
AddMySQL adds MySQL Service and starts several Agents.
It automatically adds a service to inventory, which is running on provided "node_id",
then adds "mysqld_exporter", and "qan_mysql_perfschema" agents
with provided "pmm_agent_id" and other parameters.

add_node.description: AddNodeParams is a params to add new node to inventory while adding new service.

container_id.description: Container identifier. If specified, must be a unique Docker container identifier.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name.

address.description:
Node and Service access address (DNS name or IP).
Address (and port) or socket is required.

max_slowlog_file_size.description:
If qan-mysql-slowlog-agent is added, slowlog file is rotated at this size if > 0.
If zero, server's default value is used.
Use negative value to disable rotation.

node_id.description:
Node identifier on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

node_name.description:
Node name on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

pmm_agent_id.description: The "pmm-agent" identifier which should run agents. Required.

port.description:
Service Access port.
Port is required when the address present.

qan_mysql_perfschema.description: If true, adds qan-mysql-perfschema-agent for provided service.

qan_mysql_slowlog.description: If true, adds qan-mysql-slowlog-agent for provided service.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Required.

socket.description:
Service Access socket.
Address (and port) or socket is required.

tablestats_group_table_limit.description:
Tablestats group collectors will be disabled if there are more than that number of tables.
If zero, server's default value is used.
Use negative value to disable them.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

mysqld_exporter.description: MySQLdExporter runs on Generic or Container Node and exposes MySQL Service metrics.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

status.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

tablestats_group_disabled.description: True if tablestats group collectors are currently disabled.

tablestats_group_table_limit.description:
Tablestats group collectors are disabled if there are more than that number of tables.
0 means tablestats group collectors are always enabled (no limit).
Negative value means tablestats group collectors are always disabled.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

qan_mysql_perfschema.description: QANMySQLPerfSchemaAgent runs within pmm-agent and sends MySQL Query Analytics data to the PMM Server.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

post.summary:
AddPostgreSQL adds PostgreSQL Service and starts postgres exporter.
It automatically adds a service to inventory, which is running on provided "node_id",
then adds "postgres_exporter" with provided "pmm_agent_id" and other parameters.

add_node.description: AddNodeParams is a params to add new node to inventory while adding new service.

container_id.description: Container identifier. If specified, must be a unique Docker container identifier.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name.

address.description: Node and Service access address (DNS name or IP). Required.

node_id.description:
Node identifier on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

node_name.description:
Node name on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

pmm_agent_id.description: The "pmm-agent" identifier which should run agents. Required.

qan_postgresql_pgstatements_agent.description: If true, adds qan-postgresql-pgstatements-agent for provided service.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Required.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation. Uses sslmode=required instead of verify-full.

postgres_exporter.description: PostgresExporter runs on Generic or Container Node and exposes PostgreSQL Service metrics.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

status.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation. Uses sslmode=required instead of verify-full.

qan_postgresql_pgstatements_agent.description: QANPostgreSQLPgStatementsAgent runs within pmm-agent and sends PostgreSQL Query Analytics data to the PMM Server.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

status.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

username.description: PostgreSQL username for getting pg stat statements data.

service.description: PostgreSQLService represents a generic PostgreSQL instance.

node_id.description: Node identifier where this instance runs.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name.

A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized

post.summary:
AddProxySQL adds ProxySQL Service and starts several Agents.
It automatically adds a service to inventory, which is running on provided "node_id",
then adds "proxysql_exporter" with provided "pmm_agent_id" and other parameters.

add_node.description: AddNodeParams is a params to add new node to inventory while adding new service.

container_id.description: Container identifier. If specified, must be a unique Docker container identifier.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name.

address.description:
Node and Service access address (DNS name or IP).
Address (and port) or socket is required.

node_id.description:
Node identifier on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

node_name.description:
Node name on which a service is been running.
Exactly one of these parameters should be present: node_id, node_name, add_node.

pmm_agent_id.description: The "pmm-agent" identifier which should run agents. Required.

port.description:
Service Access port.
Port is required when the address present.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Required.

socket.description:
Service Access socket.
Address (and port) or socket is required.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

proxysql_exporter.description: ProxySQLExporter runs on Generic or Container Node and exposes ProxySQL Service metrics.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.

 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.

 - DONE: Agent finished.

post.summary: AddRDS adds RDS instance.

address.description: Address used to connect to it.

custom_labels.description: Custom user-assigned labels for Node and Service.

engine.description: DiscoverRDSEngine describes supported RDS instance engines.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name. Defaults to AWS instance ID.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name. Defaults to AWS instance ID.

tablestats_group_table_limit.description:
Tablestats group collectors will be disabled if there are more than that number of tables.
If zero, server's default value is used.
Use negative value to disable them.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

mysql.description: MySQLService represents a generic MySQL instance.

address.description:
Access address (DNS name or IP).
Address (and port) or socket is required.

node_id.description: Node identifier where this instance runs.

port.description:
Access port.
Port is required when the address present.

service_name.description: Unique across all Services user-defined name.

socket.description:
Access unix socket.
Address (and port) or socket is required.

mysqld_exporter.description: MySQLdExporter runs on Generic or Container Node and exposes MySQL Service metrics.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

pmm_agent_id.description: The pmm-agent identifier which runs this instance.

status.description:
AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

tablestats_group_disabled.description: True if tablestats group collectors are currently disabled.

tablestats_group_table_limit.description:
Tablestats group collectors are disabled if there are more than that number of tables.
0 means tablestats group collectors are always enabled (no limit).
Negative value means tablestats group collectors are always disabled.

tls_skip_verify.description: Skip TLS certificate and hostname validation.

node.description: RemoteRDSNode represents remote RDS Node. Agents can't run on Remote RDS Nodes.

node_name.description: Unique across all Nodes user-defined name.

qan_mysql_perfschema.description: QANMySQLPerfSchemaAgent runs within pmm-agent and sends MySQL Query Analytics data to the PMM Server.

disabled.description: Desired Agent status: enabled (false) or disabled (true).

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.

rds_exporter.description: RDSExporter runs on Generic or Container Node and exposes RemoteRDS Node metrics.

listen_port.description: Listen port for scraping metrics (the same for several configurations).

AgentStatus represents actual Agent status.

 - STARTING: Agent is starting.
 - RUNNING: Agent is running.
 - WAITING: Agent encountered error and will be restarted automatically soon.
 - STOPPING: Agent is stopping.
 - DONE: Agent finished.
